content.description: In a large, isolated population of an insect species, a specific gene locus has one dominant allele <math alttext="uppercase A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and one recessive allele <math alttext="lowercase a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. The genotype frequencies of the gene were collected for ten generations, as shown in Table 1.
content.question: Table 1. Genotypic frequencies over ten generations in an insect species <math alttext="uppercase A uppercase A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>A</mi><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="uppercase A lowercase a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>A</mi><mi>a</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="lowercase a lowercase a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>a</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> Generation 1 0.47 0.43 0.10 Generation 5 0.32 0.60 0.08 Generation 10 0.20 0.75 0.05 Which of the following could best account for the change in genotypic frequencies over the ten generations?

choices.label: Because the <math alttext="uppercase A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> allele is unstable, over the course of the study most of the <math alttext="uppercase A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> alleles mutated to become <math alttext="lowercase a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> alleles.
The population is in Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium, which allows for changes in genotypic frequencies every generation.
The population is not exhibiting random mating between individuals.
The population is becoming extinct because the <math alttext="lowercase a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> allele is disappearing.

content.answer: The population is not exhibiting random mating between individuals.

skill.text: 1.C: Explain biological concepts and processes in applied contexts.
